SEARCH
Package danogl.collisions

Class GameObjectCollection

java.lang.Object
danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<GameObject>
public class GameObjectCollection extends Object implements Iterable<GameObject>
A container for accumulating/removing instances of GameObject and for handling their collisions. The items in this collection can be iterated using a foreach loop (e.g., for(GameObject go : gameObjectCollection) {...} ).
Author:
Dan Nirel

    • reverseOrder

      public Iterable<GameObject> reverseOrder()
      Returns an Iterable of the GameObjects in this collection, in reverse order of the drawing order. Includes objects of all layers.
      See Also:
      • objectsInLayer(int)

    • addGameObject

      public void addGameObject(GameObject obj, int layerId)
      Add the specified GameObject. Important note: the object will only be added at the end of the nearest invocation of handleCollisions. Until such time, traversal of the objects in this container using the foreach loop will not show this object. Also note that objects are rendered in the order they are added. Thus, the last object added will always be in the foreground.
      Parameters:
      obj - The GameObject to add.
      layerId - The id of the layer to which obj should be added.

    • addGameObject

      public void addGameObject(GameObject obj)
      Add the specified obj to the default layer.
      See Also:
      • addGameObject(GameObject, int)

    • removeGameObject

      public boolean removeGameObject(GameObject obj, int layerId)
      Remove the specified GameObject. Important note: the object will only be removed at the end of the nearest invocation of handleCollisions. Until such time, traversal of the objects in this container using the foreach loop will still show this object.
      Parameters:
      obj - The GameObject to remove.
      layerId - id of the layer to remove object from
      Returns:
      false if the object does not exist in the collection, or it exists but is already queued for removal, true if removal was successful.

    • removeGameObject

      public boolean removeGameObject(GameObject obj)
      Removes an object from the default layer.
      See Also:
      • removeGameObject(GameObject, int)

    • registerPairCollisionHandler

      public void registerPairCollisionHandler(PairCollisionHandler pairCollisionHandler)
      Register another implementation of PairCollisionHandler, which creates the collision data of two objects implementing Collider. Thus the engine can be extended to support collisions of custom shapes.

    • update

      public void update(float deltaTime)
      Updates the internal structures of the collection. Does not update the objects themselves.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - Time since last frame

    • handleCollisions

      public void handleCollisions()
      Looks for collisions between the accumulated GameObjects. When two objects enter a new collision, their shouldCollideWith method is invoked. If both objects return true, a collision occurs: On the first frame of collision, their onCollisionEnter method is invoked. For every frame they stay in collision, including the first frame, their onCollisionStay method is invoked. On the first frame after the collision ends, their onCollisionExit method is invoked. The method additionally executes the pending actions of adding and removing objects via the addGameObject/removeGameObject methods. This occurs after all pair-handling already took place. To alter the broadphase of the collision detection (which pairs should be checked for collisions), override this method and use the protected method handlePair.

    • isLayerEmpty

      public boolean isLayerEmpty(int layerId)
      Is the specified layer empty of objects

      public Iterable<GameObject> objectsInLayer(int layerId)

    • handlePair

      protected boolean handlePair(GameObject obj1, GameObject obj2)
      Calls any callbacks required on the objects (if any), and resolves collisions if needed using resolver.
      Returns:
      whether the pair collided or not.
